newsitem.title: POLAND: Mostostal buys air cleaning devices maker.
newsitem.headline: Mostostal buys air cleaning devices maker.

text.p: Polish construction company Mostostal Krakow SA paid 2.7 million zlotys for a controlling stake in Opam Sp. z o.o., an air cleaning and air-conditioning equipment maker, the Treasury Ministry said.

It said in a statement that Mostostal bought 75 percent in the firm, whose full name is Przedsiebiorstwo Projektowania Dostaw i Realizacji Obiektow Ochorony Powietrza Opam Sp. z o.o., jointly with private investor Eugeniusz Cwieczek.
It said that Mostostal bought 16,185 Opam's shares while Cwieczek paid 416,029 zlotys for 2,490 shares.
Mostostal also agreed to increase Opam's capital by 870,000 zlotys within the next two years and maintain the firm's employment at the current level.
Opam is based in the southern city of Katowice.
